tr.td: Functional relationships
(reaction) EC A is kind of (reaction) EC B
(reaction) EC B includes (reaction) EC A
is kind of (ISA) relationship
EC A is a component of EC B
EC B contains EC A
is part of (part-whole) relationship
EC A is involved in metabolic process Z
EC B is involved in metabolic process Z
metabolic relationship
product of EC A is a substrate of EC B
substrate of EC B is a product of EC A
more specified metabolic relationship
EC A activates EC B
EC B is activated by EC A
positive regulatory relationship
EC A inactivates EC B
EC B is inactivated by EC A
negative regulatory relationship
EC A phosphorylates EC B
EC B is phosphorylated by EC A
enzyme-substrate relationship
EC A dephosphorylates EC B
EC B is dephosphorylated by EC A
enzyme-substrate relationship
EC A is not identical to EC B
EC B is not identical to EC A
theoretically, all EC entries should be not identical
EC A is probably identical to EC B
EC B is probably identical to EC A
if proven, one of the entries should be deleted "as identical to"
EC A is related to EC B
EC B is related to EC A
unspecified relationship
Historical relationships
EC A is transferred to EC B
EC B replaces EC A
EC entry transfer
EC A is incorporated in EC B
EC B incorporates EC A
EC A and EC B are merged

EC A is part transferred to EC B1
EC A is part transferred to EC B2
...

EC B1 covers part of EC A
EC B2 covers part of EC A
...
EC A is split
